answerText: ergodicity[10] Way down the subset hierarchy of ergodic dynamical systems are "shifts" named for this Swissman that are isomorphic if they have the same entropy, according to an "extremely deep" theorem of Donald Ornstein. This guy's namesake process is a sequence of trials that only have two outcomes, like flipping a coin.
heading: PADAWAN |2014 | 14 | 19 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Gran Colombia [do NOT accept "Colombia"] [10] Name this term applied to dynamical systems in which one can replace time averages of a function over some period T, in the limit of T going to infinity, with a phase space average
